summary: Killing Eve Season 1 Recap Video & Season 2 Trailer - Killing Eve centers on two women; Eve is a bored, whip-smart, pay-grade...
caption: Killing Eve Season 1 Recap Video & Season 2 Trailer - Killing Eve centers on two women; Eve is a bored, whip-smart, pay-grade MI5 security officer whose desk-bound job doesn’t fulfill her fantasies of being a spy. Villanelle is a mercurial, talented killer who clings to the luxuries her violent job affords her. Killing Eve topples the typical spy-action thriller as these two fiercely intelligent women, equally obsessed with each other, go head to head in an epic game of cat and mouse.

tags: i'm not saying i'm right i'm just saying this is how i interpret the scene and the characters
summary: When we talk about Eve and Villanelle interacting with one another obviously the best scenes are the dinner scene in 1x05 and...
body:
When we talk about Eve and Villanelle interacting with one another obviously the best scenes are the dinner scene in 1x05 and the scene in the season 1 finale. However, I’m also a sucker for the scenes in which you can clearly see Eve breaking something inside Villanelle. We saw it for the first time when she first saw Eve and was immediately obsessed with her, when they did her evaluation and they presented her with a drawing of a woman with amazing hair.

I just want to talk about how much I love this particular scene, too.

Eve chooses not to run. She’s terrified, but she’s starting to realize that in order to survive she has to play the game. So she decides to face the assassin, and it’s definitely not something Villanelle is used to experiencing. She’s used to people cowering, running and screaming for their life. Maybe she enjoys it, even. This? Eve stopping the car and getting out to confront her face to face, is something that catches her off guard momentarily.

Maybe she’s finally met her match.

But we can’t have that, now can we?

Raising her gun only slows Eve down. It doesn’t make her cower or run away. At best, it only makes Eve think “am I doing the right thing?” It’s still not quite the reaction she’s used to getting. So, what else can Villanelle do to manipulate Eve if Eve is at least a little convinced that she’s going to let her walk away alive?

She puts the gun on herself and Eve screams. She’s finally getting the emotional response she’s been craving and Eve begins to fully realize just who she’s dealing with.

(Damn, this girl crazy.)

Having regained control over the situation, Villanelle is pleased to leave it at that and even presses a flirtatious kiss to the barrel of her gun. I think that perfectly describes their relationship thus far about how in the beginning it’s mostly about Villanelle’s obsession with Eve and her constant not-so-innocent teasing. I’m excited to see Eve develop into a character that becomes her equal more and more and in a way, I don’t think this show is just going to be about killing pieces of Eve, it may also be about breaking some things within Villanelle.

Maybe she’s finally met her match.

But we can’t have that, now can we?

Raising her gun only slows Eve down. It doesn’t make her cower or run away. At best, it only makes Eve think “am I doing the right thing?” It’s still not quite the reaction she’s used to getting. So, what else can Villanelle do to manipulate Eve if Eve is at least a little convinced that she’s going to let her walk away alive?

She puts the gun on herself and Eve screams. She’s finally getting the emotional response she’s been craving and Eve begins to fully realize just who she’s dealing with.

(Damn, this girl crazy.)

Having regained control over the situation, Villanelle is pleased to leave it at that and even presses a flirtatious kiss to the barrel of her gun. I think that perfectly describes their relationship thus far about how in the beginning it’s mostly about Villanelle’s obsession with Eve and her constant not-so-innocent teasing. I’m excited to see Eve develop into a character that becomes her equal more and more and in a way, I don’t think this show is just going to be about killing pieces of Eve, it may also be about breaking some things within Villanelle.
